input: DOCTOR: What brings you in today?\nPATIENT: Well, I’m a 72-year-old woman, and I woke up today and couldn’t see out of my right eye at all. I’ve had this bad headache on my temples for a couple of weeks, and it’s been really sore when I try to comb my hair. I feel kind of tired and maybe a little strange overall.
output:
THINKING: The patient has now mentioned being a 72-year-old woman. She reports waking up with complete vision loss in her right eye today, as well as a two-week history of a severe headache located on her temples. The headache is described as really sore when she tries to comb her hair. She also reports feeling somewhat tired and "maybe a little strange" overall. These are all confirmed facts; no new clinical details are introduced beyond what has already been documented.

ANSWER: The patient is a 72-year-old woman who woke up today with complete vision loss in her right eye. She has had a severe, temple-located headache for about two weeks, which is very sore when she attempts to comb her hair. She reports feeling tired and somewhat "strange" overall.

input:
DOCTOR: What brings you in today?
PATIENT: Well, I’m a 72-year-old woman, and I woke up today and couldn’t see out of my right eye at all. I’ve had this bad headache on my temples for a couple of weeks, and it’s been really sore when I try to comb my hair. I feel kind of tired and maybe a little strange overall.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about how your vision has changed today—did it happen suddenly or gradually—and if you've noticed any other new symptoms or changes in how you're feeling overall?
PATIENT: It was really sudden, like one moment I could see fine and the next thing, my right eye was just all blurry and dark. And I’ve been feeling more tired and kind of achy, especially around my head and jaw, like when I chew.
output:
THINKING: The patient has reiterated her age, gender, and the sudden loss of vision in her right eye today. She confirms a two-week history of a severe headache on her temples, sore when combing her hair, and reports feeling tired and "maybe a little strange" overall. She also describes recent symptoms of achiness around her head and jaw, especially when chewing, which were new details not previously documented.  
ANSWER: The patient is a 72-year-old woman who woke up today with complete vision loss in her right eye. She has had a severe headache for about two weeks located on her temples, which is very sore when she tries to comb her hair. She also reports feeling tired, somewhat strange overall, and has experienced achiness around her head and jaw, particularly when chewing.
